summary: This document is email correspondence between the court and counsel regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case (US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330). It transmits joint proposed juror questionnaires and voir dire documents under seal and notes the government's production of Jencks Act material to the defense.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The Honorable Judge presiding over the US v. Maxwell case; her chambers are corresponding with counsel regarding procedural filings.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: A staff member from Judge Nathan's chambers who sent an email requesting Word document versions of the proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced (US v. Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330).

connections.description: Judge Nathan is the presiding judicial officer over the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Submission of Joint Proposed Jury Documents
events.description: The parties (prosecution and defense) submitted a joint proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire to the court, requesting they be accepted under seal.

events.title: Court Request for Document Versions
events.description: Judge Nathan's chambers requested that counsel provide Word document versions of the proposed juror questionnaire and voir dire.

events.title: Government Production of Jencks Material
events.description: The Government produced Jencks Act material and exhibits to the defense, as noted in the correspondence.

keyFacts: The document is part of the pre-trial preparation for the criminal case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The prosecution and defense jointly proposed a juror questionnaire and voir dire, requesting the court accept them under seal.
The government produced Jencks Act material to the defense, which typically includes prior statements of witnesses the government intends to call at trial.
Judge Alison J. Nathan is the presiding judge in the case, and her chambers are actively managing pre-trial filings.
